noteLab.gui
Class AutoButton

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.AbstractButton
                  javax.swing.JButton
                      noteLab.gui.AutoButton
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class AutoButton
extends javax.swing.JButton

With a regular JButton an ActionEvent is sent to all listeners when the button is clicked. A button of this type of the other hand sends ActionEvents every t milliseconds, where t can be adjusted. Specifically, the user must click the button. Then within a given amount of time (called the initial delay), the user must press and hold the button down. Then every delay milliseconds, an ActionEvent is sent to all of the button's listeners.

Author:
Dominic Kramer
See Also:

Constructor Detail

AutoButton

public AutoButton(javax.swing.Icon icon,
                  int initDelay,
                  int delay)
Used to construct a button with the given icon.

Parameters:
icon - The icon displayed on this button.
initDelay - After pressing the button, this is the amount of time (in milliseconds) in which the user can press and hold down the button to have it continuously send ActionEvents.
delay - The amount of time (in milliseconds) that this class waits before resending ActionEvents to its listeners (if this class's button is pressed down).
